skill.name: Security Skill
skill.description: Security validation, vulnerability scanning, and compliance checking.
skill.summary: Security validation, vulnerability scanning, and compliance checking.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This skill consists solely of documentation providing security guidance. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own markdown file. Pure prompt-based skill that only documents security best practices and references external tools.

content.user_title: Validate security and scan for vulnerabilities
content.value_statement: Projects need security validation to prevent vulnerabilities. This skill provides automated security scanning, GPG and SSH key validation, and compliance checking against OWASP standards.
actual_capabilities: Validate GPG and SSH key configuration
Run Bandit security scanner on Python code
Scan dependencies with pip-audit and Safety
limitations: Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Automated Security Audits
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive security scans on codebases before deployment to catch vulnerabilities early.

use_cases.title: Pre-commit Validation
use_cases.description: Validate GPG signing and check for secrets before commits to ensure code integrity.

use_cases.title: Dependency Vulnerability Checks
use_cases.description: Scan Python dependencies for known vulnerabilities using pip-audit and Safety.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Security Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security scan on my project using Bandit and check dependencies for vulnerabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Signing Keys
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my GPG signing key and SSH configuration. Check if git signing is properly set up.

prompt_templates.title: OWASP Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Walk through the OWASP Top 10 checklist and identify any security concerns in my code. Check for injection risks, broken authentication, sensitive data exposure, and other common vulnerabilities.
prompt_templates.description: Walk through the OWASP Top 10 checklist and identify any security concerns in my code.

prompt_templates.title: Semgrep Deep Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Semgrep with auto-config to perform deep security analysis on my codebase.

output_examples.input: Run security scan on my Python project
output: Bandit scan results: No high severity issues found
Dependency audit: 3 medium severity vulnerabilities detected
Recommendation: Update package to latest secure version

best_practices: Run security scans before every code commit to catch issues early
Keep dependencies updated to address known vulnerabilities
Use GPG signing for all commits to verify code authenticity
anti_patterns: Skipping security scans to meet deadlines
Not validating signing keys before releasing code

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Python security scanning. Bandit, pip-audit, and Safety target Python code and dependencies.

faq.question: What security tools are integrated?
faq.answer: Bandit, pip-audit, Safety, Semgrep, GPG, and SSH validation tools are referenced and documented.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically fix vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: No, the skill identifies vulnerabilities but does not automatically apply fixes. You must address issues manually.

faq.question: Is my code data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only runs read-only scans on your codebase. No code or data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why did Bandit report no issues?
faq.answer: This means your code passed security checks. Review medium issues and consider addressing low-severity warnings for hardening.

faq.question: How is this different from manual security reviews?
faq.answer: This skill automates repetitive security checks, ensuring consistent coverage. It complements but does not replace expert security reviews.
